SUMMARY
The Service Operations Analytics & Reporting organization supports the data and analytical needs of Evernorth Service Operations. As a center of excellence for best practices in Data Platforms, Web Platforms, Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Business Intelligence, the team brings together data from contact centers, print and digital communications, eligibility, client benefit setup, coverage review and beyond in novel ways to provide actionable insights to business partners from front-line Prior Authorization Representatives and Patient Care Advocates to Senior Leadership across Evernorth, Express Scripts, and Cigna. By turning data into information, and information into insight, we passionately strive to make the operational services provided by Evernorth to patients, clients, and prescribers the safest, most efficient, most convenient, and most trusted in the world.
This position will partner with operations, resource management, and IT teams in the visioning and design of machine learning and statistical models to drive differentiated service, operational efficiency, and a positive member experience. The Data Science Advisor will work to realize these solutions through data acquisition across a wide portfolio of source systems, data preparation, data visualization, and statistical analysis providing information that is both relevant and actionable. In addition, the position will support existing reports and tools, answer ad hoc inquiries as needed.
This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation
REQUIREMENTS

Locate, extract, manipulate, and organize data from operational source systems in support of analytic tool development (SQL, Microsoft SSIS, Python)

Partner with varying levels of operations and resource management leadership to understand challenges, goals, and pain points, designing analytic solutions to address them

Produce models and analytics with Python using widely available and homegrown libraries Enhance/troubleshoot existing reports, tools, and data feeds to support evolving business needs

Develop data visualizations that present information to operations and resource management personnel that is both relevant and actionable (Tableau, Thoughtspot, Power BI)

Produce models and analytics with Python using widely available and homegrown libraries Enhance/troubleshoot existing reports, tools, and data feeds to support evolving business needs

Present results and/or recommendations to key business stakeholders up to and including Sr. Staff

Design, build, deploy, and tune analytic algorithms

Flexibly support ad hoc reporting/analytics needs when called upon
QUALIFICATIONS

3+ years' of experience and proven track record of developing analytical solutions from a data science perspective

Ability to combine creativity with analytical, technical, and business acumen to problem solve and extrapolate data into information to drive process improvements

Experience with SQL, Python & Tableau required

Understanding and experience with leading supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods such as Multiple and Logistic Regression and Natural Language Processing

Proven ability to collaborate with others, establish working relationships, and communicate effectively with a variety of stakeholders

Comfortable working in environments with varying levels of ambiguity, complexity, uncertainty, and change and turning high-level ideas into concrete action plan and provide solution designs
This role is WAH/Flex which allows most work to be performed at home. Employees must be fully vaccinated if they choose to come onsite.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $95,800 - $159,600, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.
This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.
Helping our customers achieve healthier, more secure lives is at the heart of what we do. While you take care of our customers, we’ll take care of you through a comprehensive benefits program that helps you be at your best. Starting on day one of your employment, you’ll be offered several health-related benefits including medical, vision, dental, and best in class well-being and behavioral health programs. We also offer 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year and dozens of corporate discounts on essentials you use every day. For more details on our employee benefits programs, please visit the “Life at Cigna” tab on our careersite: www.cigna.com/careers
About Cigna
Cigna Corporation exists to improve lives. We are a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. Together, with colleagues around the world, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation. When you work with us, or one of our subsidiaries, you’ll enjoy meaningful career experiences that enrich people’s lives. What difference will you make?

About Pinterest:
Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It's where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you'll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You'll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.
We're looking for an analytical thinker to help us understand how our infrastructure costs scale with our business. You will work closely with the Infrastructure Governance group and a cross functional team of engineering, product and finance stakeholders to increase visibility into our infrastructure related trends and to suggest actions we can take to make it more predictable over time. The ideal candidate will possess both strong technical and analytical skills; be able to communicate technical details, at a level appropriate for the audience.

Our Company:
At Cerebral, we're on a mission to improve access to long-term, high-quality mental health care for all. We believe that everyone everywhere deserves to get the care they need. And how are we doing this? By making care convenient and accessible and tackling the stigma that surrounds mental illness.
Since launching in January 2020, we have gone from a team of 5 to over 3,000 team members across the United States and in the United Kingdom working hand-in-hand to transform access to high-quality mental health care at scale. Our team will not stop building, growing, and iterating until everyone, everywhere can access high-quality mental health care without the high cost, long wait times, and stigma. Simone Biles, world champion gymnast, and mental health advocate joined Cerebral as our Chief Impact Officer to help further our mission.
We are the fastest mental health company ever to achieve unicorn status, having raised over $462 million and achieving a valuation of $4.8 billion in under two years. Cerebral's investors include SoftBank Venture Fund 2, Silver Lake, Access Industries, Bill Ackman, Chris Burch, WestCap, and Oak HC/FT.

Your principal responsibility will be for the design and implementation of primary sequence analysis algorithms encompassing image processing, times series analysis and base-calling. You will work with bench scientists and engineers from the molecular biology, chemistry, software, hardware and sequencing teams to design experiments and analyze resulting data. Duties will include integrating your solutions into product-grade code for the shipping product.
Essential Qualifications
A PhD or equivalent experience in a relevant field such as statistics, computer science, or applied mathematics.
Ability to develop quantitative methods from first principles, and a track record applying such methods to real-world problems.
Proficiency with a standard data analysis platform such as Python, R, Julia or MATLAB.

Your Job
As a Data Scientist at Indeed your role is to follow the data. Analyze, visualize, and model job search related data. You will build and implement machine learning models to make timely decisions. You will have access to unparalleled resources within Indeed to grow and develop both personally and professionally.

We are looking for a mixture between a statistician, scientist, machine learning expert and engineer: someone who has passion for building and improving Internet-scale products informed by data. The ideal candidate understands human behavior and knows what to look for in the data.

Responsibilities
Have full stack experience in data collection, aggregation, analysis, visualization, productionization, and monitoring of data science products

Data, Research & Insights
Data Science
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join a team leading efforts to further expand our customer offering for Spotify.
Location
New York or Remote Americas
Job type
Permanent
With a focus on innovation projects, you will be part of a small, agile, and constantly evolving team, working to identify and execute upon growth opportunities that meet our ambitious commercial and user experience goals.

About Us
Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on LinkedIn, Twitter and on our Blog.
About the Role
The Central Science team focuses on understanding the long-term and causal impact of actions taken by viewers, creators and Twitch. We discover insights and build prediction and causal inference tools to make these knowledge more accessible for teams across Twitch. We support a diverse set of customers including executive leaders, product managers and data staff. We are an interdisciplinary team with experts in data science, statistics, and economics.

Job Title: Lead Data Scientist - Customer Data Science
Job Description:
Data scientists at Disney Streaming Services are the insights and modeling partners for the growth, content, marketing, product, and engineering teams at Disney+, Hulu and ESPN+. They use data to empower decision-makers with information, predictions, and insights that ultimately influence the experiences of millions of users worldwide. Scientists on the team build models, perform statistical analysis, and create visualizations to provide scalable, persistent capability that is iteratively improved through direct interaction with cross-functional business partners.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Modeling: Design, build and improve machine learning models. Work end to end from data collection, feature generation and selection, algorithm development, forecasting, visualization and communicating of model results. Collaborate with engineering to productionize models.
Drive experimentation to test impact of model based optimization.

About the team
Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Job Title: Data Scientist, Marketing Science Research: Creative Shop
Job Description:
The Marketing Science Research, Creative Shop team is a quantitative research group focused on measuring the value and effectiveness of creative in advertising. The team designs and conducts research studies and leverages and develops new data sources to understand how people respond to creative content on digital platforms. The results are used to guide internal teams and are published as guidance and thought-leadership for the global advertising industry. This team helps develop world-class marketing strategies for both the world's largest advertisers and the millions of small businesses that use our platforms. In this role, you will pair your analytical skills with Meta’s unique data set to understand the role of creative in advertising. We seek an expert in data science, research methods, and developing working systems to support research. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning, is focused on results, is self-motivated, and has a history of solving problems with data-driven solutions. You will work closely with our global Creative Strategists to inform scalable strategies for creative development that achieve our clients’ business objectives. You will partner with teams in all major global markets, working to develop region-specific understanding when required. You’re a doer, who loves to ship ideas that will impact businesses of all shapes and sizes on Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp.

What you’ll be doing...
The Engineering Analytics Data Science Team has an immediate opening for a talented and experienced Principal Data Scientist with hands on expertise using large datasets to find opportunities for network operation and capital efficiency optimization and using models to test different courses of actions besides a strong interest in understanding the Telecom business model in particular and a passion for data in general. Job Title: Data Scientist, Marketing Science Research: Creative Shop
Job Description:
The Marketing Science Research, Creative Shop team is a quantitative research group focused on measuring the value and effectiveness of creative in advertising. The team designs and conducts research studies and leverages and develops new data sources to understand how people respond to creative content on digital platforms. The results are used to guide internal teams and are published as guidance and thought-leadership for the global advertising industry. This team helps develop world-class marketing strategies for both the world's largest advertisers and the millions of small businesses that use our platforms. In this role, you will pair your analytical skills with Meta’s unique data set to understand the role of creative in advertising. We seek an expert in data science, research methods, and developing working systems to support research. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning, is focused on results, is self-motivated, and has a history of solving problems with data-driven solutions. You will work closely with our global Creative Strategists to inform scalable strategies for creative development that achieve our clients’ business objectives. You will partner with teams in all major global markets, working to develop region-specific understanding when required. You’re a doer, who loves to ship ideas that will impact businesses of all shapes and sizes on Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp.

About Us

Stay up to date on all things Twitch on LinkedIn, Twitter and on our Blog.
About the Role
The Central Science team focuses on understanding the long-term and causal impact of actions taken by viewers, creators and Twitch. We discover insights and build prediction and causal inference tools to make these knowledge more accessible for teams across Twitch. We support a diverse set of customers including executive leaders, product managers and data staff. We are an interdisciplinary team with experts in data science, statistics, and economics.

The Data Team at Zoom brings data closer to the decision. We know that to deliver customer happiness we need to build best in class products. Any team, from enterprise to education, can use the Zoom Whiteboard experience to create, annotate, and share ideas from any device whether you’re in a Zoom meeting or not. This role will work closely with Product, Engineering and the Data Engineering team to help ensure the success of the product. The ideal candidate will have experience partnering with Product to define success metrics and define data requirements to ensure we are set up for success when the product or feature launches. The ideal candidate will have experience measuring product impact using causal inference and A/B testing. The individual will play a key role in providing insights around product usage beyond just the “What?” but to answer the “Why?” behind user behavior. Our team values diversity, collaboration, creativity and most importantly - having fun! Come join us!

Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It's where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. We're looking for an analytical thinker to help us understand how our infrastructure costs scale with our business. You will work closely with the Infrastructure Governance group and a cross functional team of engineering, product and finance stakeholders to increase visibility into our infrastructure related trends and to suggest actions we can take to make it more predictable over time. The ideal candidate will possess both strong technical and analytical skills; be able to communicate technical details, at a level appropriate for the audience.

Are you interested in working for a Fortune 100 retailer? Do you want to be able to apply your analytical knowledge and experience to help solve constantly changing business and customer facing opportunities?

As a Data Scientist on the Business Analytics Team, you will support Marketing Measurement, identify buying behaviors and lifestyle characteristics of customers, measure the statistically significant purchasing behavior change at the product and customer segment level, develop sales forecasting methodologies, conduct A/B tests, and work with large cloud based datasets.

providing research-based consultation and recommendations regarding the personalization of customer interfaces with Publix
developing and implementing scalable Data Science Analytical Solutions that rely on machine learning and artificial intelligence to automate and optimize key business processes and help improve efficiency and financial results

Our Company:
At Cerebral, we're on a mission to improve access to long-term, high-quality mental health care for all. We believe that everyone everywhere deserves to get the care they need. And how are we doing this? By making care convenient and accessible and tackling the stigma that surrounds mental illness.
Since launching in January 2020, we have gone from a team of 5 to over 3,000 team members across the United States and in the United Kingdom working hand-in-hand to transform access to high-quality mental health care at scale. Our team will not stop building, growing, and iterating until everyone, everywhere can access high-quality mental health care without the high cost, long wait times, and stigma. Simone Biles, world champion gymnast, and mental health advocate joined Cerebral as our Chief Impact Officer to help further our mission.
We are the fastest mental health company ever to achieve unicorn status, having raised over $462 million and achieving a valuation of $4.8 billion in under two years. Cerebral's investors include SoftBank Venture Fund 2, Silver Lake, Access Industries, Bill Ackman, Chris Burch, WestCap, and Oak HC/FT.

The Environment Modeling Team at The Climate Corporation is seeking a highly motivated geospatial data analyst with excellent Python coding skills to join our team. The position is within the science R&D team that leverages modeling, big data, and cloud computing to address scientific challenges in precision agriculture. In this position, you will build pipelines for geospatial data, and query, process, and analyze large geospatial datasets. As part of our diverse, highly dynamic group, you will work side-by-side with a team of data scientists, statisticians, soil scientists, and other geospatial scientists.

What you will do:
Query geospatial data from multiple sources
Build geospatial data pipelines for downstream model development
Clean, explore, manipulate, and analyze large geospatial datasets and develop derived features, e.g., topographical features from elevation datasets

Job summary
Amazon Web Services’ Marketing Science team is looking for an applied scientist with strong technical skills in machine learning and forecasting to drive methodology improvements and tool inventions for marketing planning, goal tracking, targeting and segmentation, while developing our long term roadmap.

The successful candidate will be a hands-on self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, humble to seek feedback and learn from peers (scientists, economists, marketing practitioners), bold to think big, has solid attention to detail and believes in challenging themselves to raise the bar continuously. The scientist will develop production models using geographical, macro-economic and customer-level panel data on forecasting, and account or segment based marketing. They will work closely with media and portfolio teams to understand business needs and with an engineering team to productionize solutions.

This role requires an individual with strong quantitative modeling skills and the ability to apply statistical/machine learning, econometric, and coding skills.

The candidate should have strong communication skills to work closely with stakeholders to translate business needs into methodology and data-driven findings into actionable insights. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist, ESG Innovation and Solutions
Job Description:
The Role: Senior Data Scientist, ESG Innovation and Analytics
Grade: 12 (internal use only)
Location: London UK, New York, Boston US, Sydney, AU

The Role: S&P Global Trucost is a leader in ESG data and risk analysis, providing data, tools and insights to companies and financial institutions for the last 18 years in order to inform capital allocation to more sustainable business models and better communicate ESG performance to their stakeholders.
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist based in London to join our ESG Innovation and Analytics Team, part of S&P Global’s newly formed ESG Organization (Sustainable1). The role will focus on building and growing the team’s capabilities in data science with a strong focus on geospatial and big data analysis. The role provides an opportunity to work on a variety of cutting-edge projects in the field of sustainable finance.

The Opportunity: In this role, you will be working across a diverse range of ESG issues covering climate change, ecosystems, biodiversity and more. With the support of the Head of Data Innovation you will lead the team’s work in this space.

S&P Global Trucost’s expertise is providing data leveraged analytics and insights on ESG performance so that businesses and investors can understand how to direct investments that create value and avoid risk. We’ve been informing companies, financial institutions, regulators and thought leaders since 2000. S&P Global Trucost’s carbon data underpins the S&P Global Carbon Efficient Index series selected by Government Pension Investment fund for Japan (GPIF) to serve as the benchmark for their ESG investment strategy. S&P Global Trucost’s clients also include DBS Bank, ERAFP, Fidelity, Future Fund, Goldman Sachs, HSBC, State Street Global Advisors and UBS among many others.

Our team is composed of experienced professionals driven to identify the transformative solutions of tomorrow. The business has a casual and friendly atmosphere with an entrepreneurial spirit. We value teamwork and it is crucial that you are a team player to be successful within our organization.

“I am looking for a seasoned Data Scientist with extensive experience in applying geospatial data science to lead on the development of new datasets and analytics to support business and investment decision-making. You must be passionate about using data to answer complex sustainability questions”.


S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $ 82,600 to $230,200 . Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.
In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. This role is not eligible for additional compensation such as an annual incentive bonus or sales commission plan.
This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires


Work with and coordinating interdisciplinary teams and projects at the intersection of large-scale datasets, geospatial analytics, remote sensing and machine learning

Conduct geospatial, remote sensing and other advanced statistical data analyses

Ensure high degree of confidence in the data products including but not limited to developing QA/QC strategies to ensure they are platform-ready

Manage key components of ongoing projects with internal and external partners, including but not limited to Technology Teams, Product Teams, Data Management Teams as well as external stakeholders or data providers

Clearly communicate insights and technical approaches verbally and in writing, including documenting analytical methodologies and other outputs appropriate for use by specialist as well as non-specialists

Work collaboratively with a diverse team across multiple locations to conduct analysis and ensure the quality of insights

Help develop reports, factsheets, blog posts, and other materials for general and specific audiences on the topics of focus

Provide feedback from the market to help shape S&P Global’s ESG product innovation roadmap


Strong quantitative background in geospatial data analytics and tools (e.g. geostatistics and related applications to GIS and remote sensing data, and GIS tools)

Experience in machine learning will be viewed favourably

Experience working with large geospatial and satellite datasets is highly desired

Strong proficiency in scientific programming languages (Python preferred)

Demonstrated skills in data and project management

Intellectual agility and comfort with working on a wide variety of environmental topics.

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Experience translating quantitative geospatial analytical information for non-specialist audiences

Ability to work independently and support a multi-disciplinary team, using independent judgment to plan, prioritize, and organize a diverse workload in a fast-paced environment

Demonstrated self-awareness, cultural competency and inclusivity, and ability to work with colleagues and stakeholders across diverse cultures and backgrounds

Self-motivated, organized, detail-oriented, with a positive, “can do” attitude


10+ years of relevant industry experience including leadership of complex projects

Proven experience managing analysis / data science teams

Experience working with GIS systems and geospatial data

MS degree in an analytical field (e.g. Statistics, Economics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Physics, and Data Science) or extensive track record as a data science practitioner.

Consulting skills, (e.g. ability to help define business problems, propose and gain alignment on solutions, and execute the implementation)

Able to convey complex information in an understandable, compelling, and persuasive manner to senior executives

Direct experience and the ability to use and coach others a range of modern data science, analytics, and reporting tools (e.g., Python, R, Dash, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, ESRI, SAS, SQL)

Prior financial services experience will be looked upon favourably but is not a prerequisite

S&P Global Corporate
At S&P Global, we don’t give you intelligence—we give you essential intelligence. The essential intelligence you need to make decisions with conviction. We’re the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks and analytics in the global capital and commodity markets. Our divisions include S&P Global Ratings, S&P Global Market Intelligence, S&P Dow Jones Indices and S&P Global Platts. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com .

S&P Global has a Securities Disclosure and Trading Policy (“the Policy”) that seeks to mitigate conflicts of interest by monitoring and placing restrictions on personal securities holding and trading. The Policy is designed to promote compliance with global regulations. In some Divisions, pursuant to the Policy’s requirements, candidates at S&P Global may be asked to disclose securities holdings. Some roles may include a trading prohibition and remediation of positions when there is an effective or potential conflict of interest. Employment at S&P Global is contingent upon compliance with the Policy.

Job Title: Data Scientist, Marketing Science Research: Creative Shop
Job Description:
The Marketing Science Research, Creative Shop team is a quantitative research group focused on measuring the value and effectiveness of creative in advertising. The team designs and conducts research studies and leverages and develops new data sources to understand how people respond to creative content on digital platforms. The results are used to guide internal teams and are published as guidance and thought-leadership for the global advertising industry. This team helps develop world-class marketing strategies for both the world's largest advertisers and the millions of small businesses that use our platforms. In this role, you will pair your analytical skills with Meta’s unique data set to understand the role of creative in advertising. We seek an expert in data science, research methods, and developing working systems to support research. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning, is focused on results, is self-motivated, and has a history of solving problems with data-driven solutions. You will work closely with our global Creative Strategists to inform scalable strategies for creative development that achieve our clients’ business objectives. You will partner with teams in all major global markets, working to develop region-specific understanding when required. You’re a doer, who loves to ship ideas that will impact businesses of all shapes and sizes on Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp.

The Environment Modeling Team at The Climate Corporation is seeking a highly motivated geospatial data analyst with excellent Python coding skills to join our team. The position is within the science R&D team that leverages modeling, big data, and cloud computing to address scientific challenges in precision agriculture. In this position, you will build pipelines for geospatial data, and query, process, and analyze large geospatial datasets. As part of our diverse, highly dynamic group, you will work side-by-side with a team of data scientists, statisticians, soil scientists, and other geospatial scientists.

What you will do:
Query geospatial data from multiple sources
Build geospatial data pipelines for downstream model development
Clean, explore, manipulate, and analyze large geospatial datasets and develop derived features, e.g., topographical features from elevation datasets

About Us
Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on LinkedIn, Twitter and on our Blog.
About the Role
The Central Science team focuses on understanding the long-term and causal impact of actions taken by viewers, creators and Twitch. We discover insights and build prediction and causal inference tools to make these knowledge more accessible for teams across Twitch. We support a diverse set of customers including executive leaders, product managers and data staff. We are an interdisciplinary team with experts in data science, statistics, and economics.

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist - People and Organizational Performance, Org Analytics
Job Description:
Who You'll Work With
You will be joining the Waltham office as part of the OrgSolutions team.
OrgSolutions combines innovative design technology and advanced analytics with deep expertise to help our clients make effective organizational decisions. OrgSolutions can help human resources and business leaders to make smarter organizational decisions by leveraging advanced data analytics, user-centric design technology and proven methodologies. These approaches help clients to answer critical questions related to cost reduction, efficiency and effectiveness streamlining, merger plans, divestments and carve outs, and talent deployment.
In creating asset-enabled practices, McKinsey is driving innovation in how we serve clients with analytics and design thinking. In recent years, McKinsey has hired thousands of technology professionals – data scientists, designers, software engineers, product managers, etc – to serve alongside generalist consultants and identify ways that technology can improve outcomes.

PhD or equivalent Master's Degree plus 4+ years of experience in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics or related field
2+ years of experience using Python, R or other traditional programming language is required
2+ years of experience in SQL
Job summary
Amazon Web Services’ Marketing Science team is looking for an applied scientist with strong technical skills in machine learning and forecasting to drive methodology improvements and tool inventions for marketing planning, goal tracking, targeting and segmentation, while developing our long term roadmap.

The successful candidate will be a hands-on self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, humble to seek feedback and learn from peers (scientists, economists, marketing practitioners), bold to think big, has solid attention to detail and believes in challenging themselves to raise the bar continuously. The scientist will develop production models using geographical, macro-economic and customer-level panel data on forecasting, and account or segment based marketing. They will work closely with media and portfolio teams to understand business needs and with an engineering team to productionize solutions.

This role requires an individual with strong quantitative modeling skills and the ability to apply statistical/machine learning, econometric, and coding skills.

The candidate should have strong communication skills to work closely with stakeholders to translate business needs into methodology and data-driven findings into actionable insights. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.

Key job responsibilities
About the team
Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

About the Role

Job summary
Amazon Web Services’ Marketing Science team is looking for an applied scientist with strong technical skills in machine learning and forecasting to drive methodology improvements and tool inventions for marketing planning, goal tracking, targeting and segmentation, while developing our long term roadmap.

The successful candidate will be a hands-on self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, humble to seek feedback and learn from peers (scientists, economists, marketing practitioners), bold to think big, has solid attention to detail and believes in challenging themselves to raise the bar continuously. The scientist will develop production models using geographical, macro-economic and customer-level panel data on forecasting, and account or segment based marketing. They will work closely with media and portfolio teams to understand business needs and with an engineering team to productionize solutions.

This role requires an individual with strong quantitative modeling skills and the ability to apply statistical/machine learning, econometric, and coding skills.

The candidate should have strong communication skills to work closely with stakeholders to translate business needs into methodology and data-driven findings into actionable insights. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.

About the team
Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Job Title: Data Scientist, Marketing Science Research: Creative Shop
Job Description:
The Marketing Science Research, Creative Shop team is a quantitative research group focused on measuring the value and effectiveness of creative in advertising. The team designs and conducts research studies and leverages and develops new data sources to understand how people respond to creative content on digital platforms. The results are used to guide internal teams and are published as guidance and thought-leadership for the global advertising industry. This team helps develop world-class marketing strategies for both the world's largest advertisers and the millions of small businesses that use our platforms. In this role, you will pair your analytical skills with Meta’s unique data set to understand the role of creative in advertising. We seek an expert in data science, research methods, and developing working systems to support research. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning, is focused on results, is self-motivated, and has a history of solving problems with data-driven solutions. You will work closely with our global Creative Strategists to inform scalable strategies for creative development that achieve our clients’ business objectives. You will partner with teams in all major global markets, working to develop region-specific understanding when required. You’re a doer, who loves to ship ideas that will impact businesses of all shapes and sizes on Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp.

SUMMARY
The Service Operations Analytics & Reporting organization supports the data and analytical needs of Evernorth Service Operations. As a center of excellence for best practices in Data Platforms, Web Platforms, Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Business Intelligence, the team brings together data from contact centers, print and digital communications, eligibility, client benefit setup, coverage review and beyond in novel ways to provide actionable insights to business partners from front-line Prior Authorization Representatives and Patient Care Advocates to Senior Leadership across Evernorth, Express Scripts, and Cigna. By turning data into information, and information into insight, we passionately strive to make the operational services provided by Evernorth to patients, clients, and prescribers the safest, most efficient, most convenient, and most trusted in the world.
This position will partner with operations, resource management, and IT teams in the visioning and design of machine learning and statistical models to drive differentiated service, operational efficiency, and a positive member experience. The Data Science Advisor will work to realize these solutions through data acquisition across a wide portfolio of source systems, data preparation, data visualization, and statistical analysis providing information that is both relevant and actionable. In addition, the position will support existing reports and tools, answer ad hoc inquiries as needed.
This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation
REQUIREMENTS

Locate, extract, manipulate, and organize data from operational source systems in support of analytic tool development (SQL, Microsoft SSIS, Python)

Partner with varying levels of operations and resource management leadership to understand challenges, goals, and pain points, designing analytic solutions to address them

Produce models and analytics with Python using widely available and homegrown libraries Enhance/troubleshoot existing reports, tools, and data feeds to support evolving business needs

Develop data visualizations that present information to operations and resource management personnel that is both relevant and actionable (Tableau, Thoughtspot, Power BI)

Produce models and analytics with Python using widely available and homegrown libraries Enhance/troubleshoot existing reports, tools, and data feeds to support evolving business needs

Present results and/or recommendations to key business stakeholders up to and including Sr. Staff

Design, build, deploy, and tune analytic algorithms

Flexibly support ad hoc reporting/analytics needs when called upon
QUALIFICATIONS

3+ years' of experience and proven track record of developing analytical solutions from a data science perspective

Ability to combine creativity with analytical, technical, and business acumen to problem solve and extrapolate data into information to drive process improvements

Experience with SQL, Python & Tableau required

Understanding and experience with leading supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods such as Multiple and Logistic Regression and Natural Language Processing

Proven ability to collaborate with others, establish working relationships, and communicate effectively with a variety of stakeholders

Comfortable working in environments with varying levels of ambiguity, complexity, uncertainty, and change and turning high-level ideas into concrete action plan and provide solution designs
This role is WAH/Flex which allows most work to be performed at home. Employees must be fully vaccinated if they choose to come onsite.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $95,800 - $159,600, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.
This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on LinkedIn, Twitter and on our Blog.
About the Role
The Central Science team focuses on understanding the long-term and causal impact of actions taken by viewers, creators and Twitch. We discover insights and build prediction and causal inference tools to make these knowledge more accessible for teams across Twitch. We support a diverse set of customers including executive leaders, product managers and data staff. We are an interdisciplinary team with experts in data science, statistics, and economics.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Modeling: Design, build and improve machine learning models. Work end to end from data collection, feature generation and selection, algorithm development, forecasting, visualization and communicating of model results. Collaborate with engineering to productionize models.
Drive experimentation to test impact of model based optimization.

Job Title: Senior Director, Data Science (Commercial Analytics) (Open to remote work, except the following locations: SD, VT, and WV)
Job Description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
NIKE is a technology company. From our flagship website and five-star mobile apps to developing products, managing big data and providing leading edge engineering and systems support, our teams at NIKE Global Technology exist to revolutionize the future at the confluence of tech and sport. We invest and develop advances in technology and employ the most creative people in the world, and then give them the support to constantly innovate, iterate and serve consumers more directly and personally. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary and collaborative, taking technology into the future and bringing the world with it.

SUMMARY
The Service Operations Analytics & Reporting organization supports the data and analytical needs of Evernorth Service Operations. As a center of excellence for best practices in Data Platforms, Web Platforms, Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Business Intelligence, the team brings together data from contact centers, print and digital communications, eligibility, client benefit setup, coverage review and beyond in novel ways to provide actionable insights to business partners from front-line Prior Authorization Representatives and Patient Care Advocates to Senior Leadership across Evernorth, Express Scripts, and Cigna. By turning data into information, and information into insight, we passionately strive to make the operational services provided by Evernorth to patients, clients, and prescribers the safest, most efficient, most convenient, and most trusted in the world.
This position will partner with operations, resource management, and IT teams in the visioning and design of machine learning and statistical models to drive differentiated service, operational efficiency, and a positive member experience. The Data Science Advisor will work to realize these solutions through data acquisition across a wide portfolio of source systems, data preparation, data visualization, and statistical analysis providing information that is both relevant and actionable. In addition, the position will support existing reports and tools, answer ad hoc inquiries as needed.
This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation
REQUIREMENTS

Locate, extract, manipulate, and organize data from operational source systems in support of analytic tool development (SQL, Microsoft SSIS, Python)

Partner with varying levels of operations and resource management leadership to understand challenges, goals, and pain points, designing analytic solutions to address them

Produce models and analytics with Python using widely available and homegrown libraries Enhance/troubleshoot existing reports, tools, and data feeds to support evolving business needs

Develop data visualizations that present information to operations and resource management personnel that is both relevant and actionable (Tableau, Thoughtspot, Power BI)

Produce models and analytics with Python using widely available and homegrown libraries Enhance/troubleshoot existing reports, tools, and data feeds to support evolving business needs

Present results and/or recommendations to key business stakeholders up to and including Sr. Staff

Design, build, deploy, and tune analytic algorithms

Flexibly support ad hoc reporting/analytics needs when called upon
QUALIFICATIONS

3+ years' of experience and proven track record of developing analytical solutions from a data science perspective

Ability to combine creativity with analytical, technical, and business acumen to problem solve and extrapolate data into information to drive process improvements

Experience with SQL, Python & Tableau required

Understanding and experience with leading supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods such as Multiple and Logistic Regression and Natural Language Processing

Proven ability to collaborate with others, establish working relationships, and communicate effectively with a variety of stakeholders

Comfortable working in environments with varying levels of ambiguity, complexity, uncertainty, and change and turning high-level ideas into concrete action plan and provide solution designs
This role is WAH/Flex which allows most work to be performed at home. Employees must be fully vaccinated if they choose to come onsite.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $95,800 - $159,600, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.
This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.
Helping our customers achieve healthier, more secure lives is at the heart of what we do. While you take care of our customers, we’ll take care of you through a comprehensive benefits program that helps you be at your best. We also offer 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year and dozens of corporate discounts on essentials you use every day. Cigna Corporation exists to improve lives. We are a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. Together, with colleagues around the world, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you'll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You'll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.
We're looking for an analytical thinker to help us understand how our infrastructure costs scale with our business. You will work closely with the Infrastructure Governance group and a cross functional team of engineering, product and finance stakeholders to increase visibility into our infrastructure related trends and to suggest actions we can take to make it more predictable over time. The ideal candidate will possess both strong technical and analytical skills; be able to communicate technical details, at a level appropriate for the audience.

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist, ESG Innovation and Solutions
Job Description:
The Role: Senior Data Scientist, ESG Innovation and Analytics
Grade: 12 (internal use only)
Location: London UK, New York, Boston US, Sydney, AU

The Role: S&P Global Trucost is a leader in ESG data and risk analysis, providing data, tools and insights to companies and financial institutions for the last 18 years in order to inform capital allocation to more sustainable business models and better communicate ESG performance to their stakeholders.
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist based in London to join our ESG Innovation and Analytics Team, part of S&P Global’s newly formed ESG Organization (Sustainable1). The role will focus on building and growing the team’s capabilities in data science with a strong focus on geospatial and big data analysis. The role provides an opportunity to work on a variety of cutting-edge projects in the field of sustainable finance.

The Opportunity: In this role, you will be working across a diverse range of ESG issues covering climate change, ecosystems, biodiversity and more. With the support of the Head of Data Innovation you will lead the team’s work in this space.

S&P Global Trucost’s expertise is providing data leveraged analytics and insights on ESG performance so that businesses and investors can understand how to direct investments that create value and avoid risk. We’ve been informing companies, financial institutions, regulators and thought leaders since 2000. S&P Global Trucost’s carbon data underpins the S&P Global Carbon Efficient Index series selected by Government Pension Investment fund for Japan (GPIF) to serve as the benchmark for their ESG investment strategy. S&P Global Trucost’s clients also include DBS Bank, ERAFP, Fidelity, Future Fund, Goldman Sachs, HSBC, State Street Global Advisors and UBS among many others.

Our team is composed of experienced professionals driven to identify the transformative solutions of tomorrow. The business has a casual and friendly atmosphere with an entrepreneurial spirit. We value teamwork and it is crucial that you are a team player to be successful within our organization.

“I am looking for a seasoned Data Scientist with extensive experience in applying geospatial data science to lead on the development of new datasets and analytics to support business and investment decision-making. You must be passionate about using data to answer complex sustainability questions”.


S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $ 82,600 to $230,200 . Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.
In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. This role is not eligible for additional compensation such as an annual incentive bonus or sales commission plan.
This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires


Work with and coordinating interdisciplinary teams and projects at the intersection of large-scale datasets, geospatial analytics, remote sensing and machine learning

Conduct geospatial, remote sensing and other advanced statistical data analyses

Ensure high degree of confidence in the data products including but not limited to developing QA/QC strategies to ensure they are platform-ready

Manage key components of ongoing projects with internal and external partners, including but not limited to Technology Teams, Product Teams, Data Management Teams as well as external stakeholders or data providers

Clearly communicate insights and technical approaches verbally and in writing, including documenting analytical methodologies and other outputs appropriate for use by specialist as well as non-specialists

Work collaboratively with a diverse team across multiple locations to conduct analysis and ensure the quality of insights

Help develop reports, factsheets, blog posts, and other materials for general and specific audiences on the topics of focus

Provide feedback from the market to help shape S&P Global’s ESG product innovation roadmap


Strong quantitative background in geospatial data analytics and tools (e.g. geostatistics and related applications to GIS and remote sensing data, and GIS tools)

Experience in machine learning will be viewed favourably

Experience working with large geospatial and satellite datasets is highly desired

Strong proficiency in scientific programming languages (Python preferred)

Demonstrated skills in data and project management

Intellectual agility and comfort with working on a wide variety of environmental topics.

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Experience translating quantitative geospatial analytical information for non-specialist audiences

Ability to work independently and support a multi-disciplinary team, using independent judgment to plan, prioritize, and organize a diverse workload in a fast-paced environment

Demonstrated self-awareness, cultural competency and inclusivity, and ability to work with colleagues and stakeholders across diverse cultures and backgrounds

Self-motivated, organized, detail-oriented, with a positive, “can do” attitude


10+ years of relevant industry experience including leadership of complex projects

Proven experience managing analysis / data science teams

Experience working with GIS systems and geospatial data

MS degree in an analytical field (e.g. Statistics, Economics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Physics, and Data Science) or extensive track record as a data science practitioner.

Consulting skills, (e.g. ability to help define business problems, propose and gain alignment on solutions, and execute the implementation)

Able to convey complex information in an understandable, compelling, and persuasive manner to senior executives

Direct experience and the ability to use and coach others a range of modern data science, analytics, and reporting tools (e.g., Python, R, Dash, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, ESRI, SAS, SQL)

Prior financial services experience will be looked upon favourably but is not a prerequisite

S&P Global Corporate
At S&P Global, we don’t give you intelligence—we give you essential intelligence. The essential intelligence you need to make decisions with conviction. We’re the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks and analytics in the global capital and commodity markets. Our divisions include S&P Global Ratings, S&P Global Market Intelligence, S&P Dow Jones Indices and S&P Global Platts. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com .

S&P Global has a Securities Disclosure and Trading Policy (“the Policy”) that seeks to mitigate conflicts of interest by monitoring and placing restrictions on personal securities holding and trading. Some roles may include a trading prohibition and remediation of positions when there is an effective or potential conflict of interest. Employment at S&P Global is contingent upon compliance with the Policy.

FULL TIME, US-REMOTE

While providing these insights, we also need to ensure that we’re meeting the consent, privacy, and regulatory needs of hundreds of millions of users worldwide.

Any team, from enterprise to education, can use the Zoom Whiteboard experience to create, annotate, and share ideas from any device whether you’re in a Zoom meeting or not. This role will work closely with Product, Engineering and the Data Engineering team to help ensure the success of the product. The ideal candidate will have experience partnering with Product to define success metrics and define data requirements to ensure we are set up for success when the product or feature launches. The ideal candidate will have experience measuring product impact using causal inference and A/B testing. The individual will play a key role in providing insights around product usage beyond just the “What?” but to answer the “Why?” behind user behavior. Our team values diversity, collaboration, creativity and most importantly - having fun! Come join us!

Job Title: Senior Director, Data Science (Commercial Analytics) (Open to remote work, except the following locations: SD, VT, and WV)
Job Description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
NIKE is a technology company. From our flagship website and five-star mobile apps to developing products, managing big data and providing leading edge engineering and systems support, our teams at NIKE Global Technology exist to revolutionize the future at the confluence of tech and sport. We invest and develop advances in technology and employ the most creative people in the world, and then give them the support to constantly innovate, iterate and serve consumers more directly and personally. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary and collaborative, taking technology into the future and bringing the world with it.

SUMMARY
The Service Operations Analytics & Reporting organization supports the data and analytical needs of Evernorth Service Operations. As a center of excellence for best practices in Data Platforms, Web Platforms, Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Business Intelligence, the team brings together data from contact centers, print and digital communications, eligibility, client benefit setup, coverage review and beyond in novel ways to provide actionable insights to business partners from front-line Prior Authorization Representatives and Patient Care Advocates to Senior Leadership across Evernorth, Express Scripts, and Cigna. By turning data into information, and information into insight, we passionately strive to make the operational services provided by Evernorth to patients, clients, and prescribers the safest, most efficient, most convenient, and most trusted in the world.
This position will partner with operations, resource management, and IT teams in the visioning and design of machine learning and statistical models to drive differentiated service, operational efficiency, and a positive member experience. The Data Science Advisor will work to realize these solutions through data acquisition across a wide portfolio of source systems, data preparation, data visualization, and statistical analysis providing information that is both relevant and actionable. In addition, the position will support existing reports and tools, answer ad hoc inquiries as needed.
This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation
REQUIREMENTS

Locate, extract, manipulate, and organize data from operational source systems in support of analytic tool development (SQL, Microsoft SSIS, Python)

Partner with varying levels of operations and resource management leadership to understand challenges, goals, and pain points, designing analytic solutions to address them

Produce models and analytics with Python using widely available and homegrown libraries Enhance/troubleshoot existing reports, tools, and data feeds to support evolving business needs

Develop data visualizations that present information to operations and resource management personnel that is both relevant and actionable (Tableau, Thoughtspot, Power BI)

Produce models and analytics with Python using widely available and homegrown libraries Enhance/troubleshoot existing reports, tools, and data feeds to support evolving business needs

Present results and/or recommendations to key business stakeholders up to and including Sr. Staff

Design, build, deploy, and tune analytic algorithms

Flexibly support ad hoc reporting/analytics needs when called upon
QUALIFICATIONS

3+ years' of experience and proven track record of developing analytical solutions from a data science perspective

Ability to combine creativity with analytical, technical, and business acumen to problem solve and extrapolate data into information to drive process improvements

Experience with SQL, Python & Tableau required

Understanding and experience with leading supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods such as Multiple and Logistic Regression and Natural Language Processing

Proven ability to collaborate with others, establish working relationships, and communicate effectively with a variety of stakeholders

Comfortable working in environments with varying levels of ambiguity, complexity, uncertainty, and change and turning high-level ideas into concrete action plan and provide solution designs
This role is WAH/Flex which allows most work to be performed at home. Employees must be fully vaccinated if they choose to come onsite.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $95,800 - $159,600, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.
This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.
Helping our customers achieve healthier, more secure lives is at the heart of what we do. While you take care of our customers, we’ll take care of you through a comprehensive benefits program that helps you be at your best. Starting on day one of your employment, you’ll be offered several health-related benefits including medical, vision, dental, and best in class well-being and behavioral health programs. We also offer 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year and dozens of corporate discounts on essentials you use every day. Cigna Corporation exists to improve lives. We are a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. Together, with colleagues around the world, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation. We're looking for an analytical thinker to help us understand how our infrastructure costs scale with our business. Job Title: Senior Data Scientist, ESG Innovation and Solutions
Job Description:
The Role: Senior Data Scientist, ESG Innovation and Analytics
Grade: 12 (internal use only)
Location: London UK, New York, Boston US, Sydney, AU

The Role: S&P Global Trucost is a leader in ESG data and risk analysis, providing data, tools and insights to companies and financial institutions for the last 18 years in order to inform capital allocation to more sustainable business models and better communicate ESG performance to their stakeholders.
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist based in London to join our ESG Innovation and Analytics Team, part of S&P Global’s newly formed ESG Organization (Sustainable1). The role will focus on building and growing the team’s capabilities in data science with a strong focus on geospatial and big data analysis. The role provides an opportunity to work on a variety of cutting-edge projects in the field of sustainable finance.

The Opportunity: In this role, you will be working across a diverse range of ESG issues covering climate change, ecosystems, biodiversity and more. With the support of the Head of Data Innovation you will lead the team’s work in this space.

S&P Global Trucost’s expertise is providing data leveraged analytics and insights on ESG performance so that businesses and investors can understand how to direct investments that create value and avoid risk. We’ve been informing companies, financial institutions, regulators and thought leaders since 2000. S&P Global Trucost’s carbon data underpins the S&P Global Carbon Efficient Index series selected by Government Pension Investment fund for Japan (GPIF) to serve as the benchmark for their ESG investment strategy. S&P Global Trucost’s clients also include DBS Bank, ERAFP, Fidelity, Future Fund, Goldman Sachs, HSBC, State Street Global Advisors and UBS among many others.

Our team is composed of experienced professionals driven to identify the transformative solutions of tomorrow. The business has a casual and friendly atmosphere with an entrepreneurial spirit. We value teamwork and it is crucial that you are a team player to be successful within our organization.

“I am looking for a seasoned Data Scientist with extensive experience in applying geospatial data science to lead on the development of new datasets and analytics to support business and investment decision-making. You must be passionate about using data to answer complex sustainability questions”.


S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $ 82,600 to $230,200 . Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.
In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. This role is not eligible for additional compensation such as an annual incentive bonus or sales commission plan.
This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires


Work with and coordinating interdisciplinary teams and projects at the intersection of large-scale datasets, geospatial analytics, remote sensing and machine learning

Conduct geospatial, remote sensing and other advanced statistical data analyses

Ensure high degree of confidence in the data products including but not limited to developing QA/QC strategies to ensure they are platform-ready

Manage key components of ongoing projects with internal and external partners, including but not limited to Technology Teams, Product Teams, Data Management Teams as well as external stakeholders or data providers

Clearly communicate insights and technical approaches verbally and in writing, including documenting analytical methodologies and other outputs appropriate for use by specialist as well as non-specialists

Work collaboratively with a diverse team across multiple locations to conduct analysis and ensure the quality of insights

Help develop reports, factsheets, blog posts, and other materials for general and specific audiences on the topics of focus

Provide feedback from the market to help shape S&P Global’s ESG product innovation roadmap


Strong quantitative background in geospatial data analytics and tools (e.g. geostatistics and related applications to GIS and remote sensing data, and GIS tools)

Experience in machine learning will be viewed favourably

Experience working with large geospatial and satellite datasets is highly desired

Strong proficiency in scientific programming languages (Python preferred)

Demonstrated skills in data and project management

Intellectual agility and comfort with working on a wide variety of environmental topics.

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Experience translating quantitative geospatial analytical information for non-specialist audiences

Ability to work independently and support a multi-disciplinary team, using independent judgment to plan, prioritize, and organize a diverse workload in a fast-paced environment

Demonstrated self-awareness, cultural competency and inclusivity, and ability to work with colleagues and stakeholders across diverse cultures and backgrounds

Self-motivated, organized, detail-oriented, with a positive, “can do” attitude


10+ years of relevant industry experience including leadership of complex projects

Proven experience managing analysis / data science teams

Experience working with GIS systems and geospatial data

MS degree in an analytical field (e.g. Statistics, Economics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Physics, and Data Science) or extensive track record as a data science practitioner.

Consulting skills, (e.g. ability to help define business problems, propose and gain alignment on solutions, and execute the implementation)

Able to convey complex information in an understandable, compelling, and persuasive manner to senior executives

Direct experience and the ability to use and coach others a range of modern data science, analytics, and reporting tools (e.g., Python, R, Dash, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, ESRI, SAS, SQL)

Prior financial services experience will be looked upon favourably but is not a prerequisite

S&P Global Corporate
At S&P Global, we don’t give you intelligence—we give you essential intelligence. The essential intelligence you need to make decisions with conviction. We’re the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks and analytics in the global capital and commodity markets. Our divisions include S&P Global Ratings, S&P Global Market Intelligence, S&P Dow Jones Indices and S&P Global Platts. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com .

S&P Global has a Securities Disclosure and Trading Policy (“the Policy”) that seeks to mitigate conflicts of interest by monitoring and placing restrictions on personal securities holding and trading. The Policy is designed to promote compliance with global regulations. In some Divisions, pursuant to the Policy’s requirements, candidates at S&P Global may be asked to disclose securities holdings. Some roles may include a trading prohibition and remediation of positions when there is an effective or potential conflict of interest. Employment at S&P Global is contingent upon compliance with the Policy.

Job Title: Data Scientist - Tiktok Ads, Growth Marketing
Job Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

The mission of TikTok Ads Platform is to connect global advertisers and users, advertisers of any industry and experience level are able to get suitable marketing solutions, then easily create, manage and optimize ads. The vision is to build an easy-to-understand, easy-to-use and powerful Ads Platform.

The Ad Growth team is responsible for driving advertising growth on TikTok platform. We achieve it by acquiring and retaining advertisers through brand marketing, performance marketing, organic growth initiatives and customer management. We build products that allow us to reach more audiences, improve targeting, optimize bidding, better measure incrementally.

Responsibilities:
We are looking for experienced Data Scientists to influence the product roadmaps for the Ad Growth team.

Job Description:
Data scientists at Disney Streaming Services are the insights and modeling partners for the growth, content, marketing, product, and engineering teams at Disney+, Hulu and ESPN+. They use data to empower decision-makers with information, predictions, and insights that ultimately influence the experiences of millions of users worldwide. Scientists on the team build models, perform statistical analysis, and create visualizations to provide scalable, persistent capability that is iteratively improved through direct interaction with cross-functional business partners.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Modeling: Design, build and improve machine learning models. Work end to end from data collection, feature generation and selection, algorithm development, forecasting, visualization and communicating of model results. Collaborate with engineering to productionize models.
Drive experimentation to test impact of model based optimization.

The Data Team at Zoom brings data closer to the decision. We know that to deliver customer happiness we need to build best in class products. We support this by empowering Product with behavioral insights to help them build better products. While providing these insights, we also need to ensure that we’re meeting the consent, privacy, and regulatory needs of hundreds of millions of users worldwide.
This role will be part of the Product Intelligence team and will be working closely with the Whiteboard product team. Any team, from enterprise to education, can use the Zoom Whiteboard experience to create, annotate, and share ideas from any device whether you’re in a Zoom meeting or not. This role will work closely with Product, Engineering and the Data Engineering team to help ensure the success of the product.
